- "I can figure it out as I go along"
Character traits:

I've done it again. I started another major renovation project without proper planning. This time, I impulsively decided to knock down a wall to create an open concept living space. It wasn't until after I'd started that I realized it might be load-bearing. Now my house is a mess, potentially structurally unsound, and I'm overwhelmed by the scope of what I've begun. I know I should have consulted a structural engineer first, but I got caught up in the excitement of my vision. My ex-wife always said my impulsiveness would get me in trouble, and now I'm starting to see she might have been right. I'm living in a construction zone, and I'm not sure how to fix this mess. How can I learn to channel my creative energy into more manageable projects and resist the urge to make impulsive changes to my living space?
